docs.description:
Get any resource, as JSON, from DHIS2. Pass in any valid DHIS2 REST path, excluding /api and the version.
For the new tracker API, see `tracker.export()`

tags.title: example

tags.caption: Get all programs for an organization unit

docs.description:
Upsert a record. This will atomically update a record if it already exists, or otherwise create it.
This function does not work with the absolute tracker path `api/tracker` but rather the new tracker paths and deprecated tracker endpoints.

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Upsert a trackedEntity

tags.title: example
tags.description:
upsert(
  'dataElements',
  { filter: 'id:eq:P3jJH5Tu5VC' },
  {
    op: 'add',
    path: '/domainType',
    name: 'Acute',
    shortName: 'AFP follow-up',
    dimensionItemType: 'DATA_ELEMENT',
    legendSets: [],
    aggregationType: 'SUM',
    valueType: 'NUMBER',
    domainType: 'AGGREGATE',
    code: 'DE_359049',
    name: 'Acute Flaccid Paralysis (AFP) follow-up',
   }
 );
tags.caption: Upsert a dataElement

tags.title: param
tags.description: The type of a resource to `upsert`. E.g. `trackedEntities`.
tags.name: resourceType

tags.title: param
tags.description: A query object that allows to uniquely identify the resource to update. If no matches found, then the resource will be created.
tags.name: query

tags.title: param
tags.description: The data to use for update or create depending on the result of the query.
tags.name: data

tags.title: param
tags.description: An optional object containing query, parseAs,and headers for the request
tags.name: options

tags.title: throws
tags.description: Throws range error

tags.title: state
tags.description: {DHIS2State}

tags.title: example
tags.description: destroy('trackedEntities', 'LcRd6Nyaq7T');
tags.caption: a tracked entity instance. See [Delete tracker docs](https://docs.dhis2.org/en/develop/using-the-api/dhis-core-version-241/tracker.html#webapi_nti_import)

tags.title: param
tags.description: The type of resource to be deleted. E.g. `trackedEntities`, `organisationUnits`, etc.
tags.name: resourceType

tags.title: param
tags.description: Can be an `id` of an `object` or `path` to the `nested object` to `delete`.
tags.name: path

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional. This is useful when you want to remove multiple objects from a collection in one request. You can send `data` as, for example, `{"identifiableObjects": [{"id": "IDA"}, {"id": "IDB"}, {"id": "IDC"}]}`. See more {@link https://docs.dhis2.org/2.34/en/dhis2_developer_manual/web-api.html#deleting-objects on DHIS2 API docs}
tags.name: data

tags.title: param
tags.description: An optional object containing query, parseAs,and headers for the request.
tags.name: options

tags.title: state
tags.description: {DHIS2State}

docs.description: Creates a custom step (or operation) for more flexible job writing.

tags.title: example
param
tags.description: is the function
tags.name: func

docs.description: A custom operation that will only execute the function if the condition returns true

tags.title: example

tags.description: The condition that returns true
tags.name: condition

tags.title: param
tags.description: The operation needed to be executed.
tags.name: operation

docs.description:
Picks out a single value from source data.
If a JSONPath returns more than one value for the reference, the first
item will be returned.

tags.title: example
tags.description: sourceValue('$.key')

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `state`.
tags.name: path

docs.description: Ensures a path points at the data.

tags.title: example
tags.description: dataPath('key')

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `data`.
tags.name: path

docs.description:
Picks out a single value from the source data objectâ€”usually `state.data`.
If a JSONPath returns more than one value for the reference, the first
item will be returned.

tags.title: example
tags.description: dataValue('key')

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `data`.
tags.name: path

docs.description: Picks out the last reference value from source data.

tags.title: example
tags.description: lastReferenceValue('key')

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `references`.
tags.name: path

docs.description:
Iterates over an array of items and invokes an operation upon each one, where the state
object is _scoped_ so that state.data is the item under iteration.
The rest of the state object is untouched and can be referenced as usual.
You can pass an array directly, or use lazy state or a JSONPath string to
reference a slice of state.

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Using lazy state ($) to iterate over items in state.data and pass each into an "insert" operation

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Iterate over items in state.data and pass each one into an "insert" operation

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Using JSON path to iterate over items in state.data and pass each one into an "insert" operation

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `state`.
tags.name: dataSource

tags.title: param
tags.description: The operation needed to be repeated.
tags.name: operation

tags.description: Name of the field

tags.description: The value itself or a sourceable operation.

tags.description: The array of objects to be grouped.

tags.title: param
tags.description: (Optional) Callback function

docs.description:
Sets a cursor property on state.
Supports natural language dates like `now`, `today`, `yesterday`, `n hours ago`, `n days ago`, and `start`,
which will be converted relative to the environment (ie, the Lightning or CLI locale). Custom timezones
are not yet supported.
You can provide a formatter to customise the final cursor value, which is useful for normalising
different inputs. The custom formatter runs after natural language date conversion.
See the usage guide at {@link https://docs.openfn.org/documentation/jobs/job-writing-guide#using-cursors}

tags.title: example
tags.description: cursor($.cursor, { defaultValue: 'today' })
tags.caption: Use a cursor from state if present, or else use the default value

tags.title: example
tags.description: cursor(22)
tags.caption: Use a pagination cursor

tags.title: param
tags.description: the cursor value. Usually an ISO date, natural language date, or page number
tags.name: value

tags.title: param
tags.description: options to control the cursor.
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: set the cursor key. Will persist through the whole run.
tags.name: options.key

tags.title: param
tags.description: the value to use if value is falsy
tags.name: options.defaultValue

tags.title: param
tags.description: custom formatter for the final cursor value
tags.name: options.format

docs.description: Run an operation and save the result to a custom key in state instead of overwriting state.data.

tags.title: example
tags.description: as('cceData', collections.get('cce-data-dhis2', { key: `*:*:${$.syncedAt}*` }));
tags.caption: Fetch cce-data from collections and store them under state.cceData

tags.title: param
tags.description: The state key to assign the result of the operation to.
tags.name: key

tags.title: param
tags.description: An operation that returns a new state object with a `data` property
tags.name: operation

docs.description:
Iterates over a collection of items and returns a new array of mapped values,
like Javascript's `Array.map()` function.

Each item in the source array will be passed into the callback function. The returned value
will be added to the new array. The callback is passed the original item, the current index
in the source array (ie, the nth item number), and the state object.

Writes a new array to `state.data` with transformed values.c array.

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Transform an array of items in state

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Map items asynchronously (e.g. fetch extra info)

tags.title: param
tags.description: An array of items or a a JSONPath string which points to an array of items.
tags.name: path

tags.title: param
tags.description: The mapping function, invoked with `(data, index, state)` for each item in the array.
tags.name: callback
